description: This warm pot of ridiculously good orzo (tiny grain-shaped pasta) is one of our favorite dishes to share on frigid days. Slowly simmered risotto-style, this pasta is combined with hearty Brussels sprouts, locally sourced shiitake mushrooms, thyme, and onion for a rich, creamy meal that’s warm and cozy when warm and cozy is most needed. Finished with sharp pecorino cheese, this one’s definitely made for eating family-style.
name: Creamy Orzo with Pecorino Cheese and Brussels Sprouts
subtitle: with Pecorino Cheese and Brussels Sprouts
title: Creamy Orzo
cooking_tip:
Be sure to read through the entire recipe before you begin cooking. Trust us—you'll be glad you did! 

To remove the thyme leaves, pinch the stem near the top with the fingers of one hand. Swipe down the length of the stem with the fingers of the other hand from top to bottom. The leaves should break off where they meet the stem.

Toasting your orzo in olive oil creates a coating that keeps it al dente at the core—preventing it from being overcooked on the outside, but still firm on the inside. Be sure to stir often to prevent it from sticking to the pot.

steps.title: Prepare Ingredients
steps.description: Mince garlic. Strip thyme leaves, discarding stems (see Recipe Tip). Peel onion, halve, and thinly slice. Wipe mushrooms clean with a damp paper towel and thinly slice caps, discarding stems.

steps.title: Sauté Onion
steps.description: Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. When oil is shimmering, add onion and sauté, stirring occasionally, until softening, about 4 minutes. Increase heat to medium-high and cook until very soft, 2-3 minutes more.

steps.title: Sauté Brussels Sprouts
steps.description: Add another 1 tablespoon olive oil to pot with onions over medium heat. Add Brussels sprouts and mushrooms and sauté, stirring, until softened, about 6 minutes. Transfer vegetables to a bowl and set aside.

steps.title: Toast Orzo
steps.description: Wipe pot from vegetables clean and add 1 tablespoon olive oil over medium heat. When oil is shimmering, add orzo, garlic, and thyme and toast, stirring, until fragrant, about 2 minutes.

steps.title: Cook Orzo
steps.description: Add 2.5 cups water and .5 teaspoon kosher salt to pot with orzo. Increase heat to high and bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium and simmer, stirring frequently, until liquid is absorbed and orzo is tender, about 12 minutes. Remove pot from heat.

steps.title: Plate Orzo
steps.description: Add pecorino and sautéed vegetables to pot with orzo and stir to combine. Serve in pretty bowls and enjoy while it's warm and cheesy.
